name: India
about: Hindi, or more precisely Modern Standard Hindi, is an Indo-Aryan language spoken chiefly in North India. Hindi has been described as a standardised and Sanskritised register of the Hindustani language

name: German
about: German is one of the major languages of the world. It is the most spoken native language within the European Union.[3] German is also widely taught as a foreign language, especially in Europe, where it is the third most taught foreign language (after English and French), and the United States

name: Portuguese
about: The Portuguese people are a Romance nation and ethnic group indigenous to Portugal who share a common Portuguese culture, ancestry and language. The Portuguese people's heritage largely derives from the pre-Celts and Celts,

name: Arabic
about: A language family is a group of languages related through descent from a common ancestral language or parental language, called the proto-language of that family. The term reflects the tree model of language origination in historical linguistics, which makes use of a metaphor comparing languages to people in a biological family tree
